Meals will be available this week on Monday (3/30) and Wednesday (4/1) from 11:30-12:30. Children will receive two days of meals on Monday and three days of meals on Wednesday.

Meals may be picked up at these locations:
Beetree Park & King’s Table in Nashville, the gazebo in Alapaha, the Enigma Park, and the Senior Citizens Center in Ray City. Children ages 0 to 18 must be present to receive meals.

post_text:
Beginning Wednesday, March 18th, the Berrien County School System and Second Harvest of South Georgia will be feeding students at the following locations from 12:00 until 1:00:

 In Nashville at Beetree Park and the King's Table

 In Alapaha at the gazebo

 In Enigma at the Enigma park

 In Ray City at the Senior Citizens Center

Meals will be served this week Monday through Friday. We will announce the meal schedule for next week at a later time. Students eligible to receive meals must be between the age of 0-18 and present at the time of pickup. If driving to one of these locations, please remain in your vehicle and a volunteer will bring the meals to you.
Should you need additional food assistance, please email your name and phone number to help@berrien.k12.ga.us.

post_text:
Thank you to the Berrien County School System Transportation Department! We appreciate all you do in safely transporting our students each day.
In recognition of Bus Driver Appreciation Week, here are a few facts about Berrien County bus drivers:
The bus shop employees 43 people, which includes bus drivers, substitute drivers, bus monitors, mechanics, office personnel, and the director. Berrien County has 32 regular routes and 3 special ed routes, as well as 10 after school program routes. In addition, our drivers often drive students for field trips and athletic events. Our buses travel approximately 2500 miles on a daily basis and transport approximately 2200 students per day.
Berrien County bus drivers and bus shop employees take pride in their work. They have a strong commitment to the students of Berrien County and take their role within the school system seriously. We appreciate each and every one of them!
text:

Our buses travel approximately 2500 miles on a daily basis and transport approximately 2200 students per day.
Berrien County bus drivers and bus shop employees take pride in their work. They have a strong commitment to the students of Berrien County and take their role within the school system seriously. We appreciate each and every one of them!

post_text: GEMA/Homeland Security conducted walk-thru visits for all schools in Berrien County. The purpose of the visits is to ensure that all students, faculty, and staff are safe while at school. The security audit allowed the school district to review the level of safety in each school by assessing multiple indicators that apply to the total environment. A self-assessment was given to each administrator for a checklist and on the day of the visit, a GEMA representative reviewed the self-assessment and walked each school for recommendations. The Berrien County School District strives to provide a safe learning environment for all students and is reviewed regularly.

The Berrien County School District strives to provide a safe learning environment for all students and is reviewed regularly.

post_text:
SCHOOLS CLOSE

Due to the threat of severe weather from Hurricane Michael, Berrien County Schools will be closed Wednesday, October 10, for all students and faculty members. As per our school calendar, schools will remain closed Thursday and Friday, October 11th and 12th, for Fall Break. We will offer updates via websites, social media, and our alert system. Please stay safe and stay informed concerning Hurricane Michael and its effects on our area.

Berrien Elementary School
January 11, 2018 at 7:25 PM ·

Georgia Power is partnering with schools across Georgia and offering a Learning Power program that provides a comprehensive educational program that uses hands on and engaging standard based lessons. Mrs. Denise James, Georgia Power Education Coordinator for the South Region, worked with 4th grade students using mathematical algorithms to help investigate the energy efficiency of 3 different types of light bulbs: Incandescent Lights, CFL lights, & LED lights.

shared_text:
Berrien Elementary School
November 14, 2017 at 10:33 PM ·

On Thursday, Nov. 9, the BES 4th graders performed a wonderful concert for Veterans Day. The concert was to recognize and thank all of the veterans in the audience for their service to our country. The students sang a selection of 5 songs, including the Star Spangled Banner, complete with American Sign Language. To kick off the program, the MAFB Honor Guard presented the colors. The art work displayed on the stage was designed by our BES students. Mrs. Jolliff is incredibly proud of all the hard work the students put into making the performance special.

post_text:
We want to thank the volunteers who helped with the Teacher of the Year judging. Buffy Holbrook - Lanier County, Donna Drew - Coffee County and Gail Sokes - Ben HIll County.
Also, a quick shout out to Southern Grace Farms for the gift basket and Bryan Kemp, Sec. of State for the large tumbler given as an appreciation to our volunteers.

Picture left to right - Donya Gillespie, Buffy Holbrook, Donna Drew, Gail Stokes, and Keith Stone - Rotary TOTY Liason

post_text:
Students in Graphic Communication class at BHS have designed various 2018 calendars that would be a great Christmas gift and Stocking Stuffer! FOR ONLY $5!

Choose one of the designs from the picture, tell us your favorite sports team, or send us your own pictures for a customized calendar. The BHS calendar features a different sport on each page. The price list has other items we can help you with. Contact Emily Bollinger at emily.bollinger@berrien.k12.ga.us for orders or questions.

post_text: Congratulations to our Teachers of the Year from each school. Lacey Rice from Berrien Primary, Amanda Jolliff from Berrien Elementary, Allison Ray from Berrien Middle, and Dana Warren from Berrien High.
text: Congratulations to our Teachers of the Year from each school. Lacey Rice from Berrien Primary, Amanda Jolliff from Berrien Elementary, Allison Ray from Berrien Middle, and Dana Warren from Berrien High.

post_text: On Monday, October 16, 2017, the Berrien County Board of Education unanimously approved to have NO makeup days for Hurricane Irma. There are no changes to the current school calendar.
text: On Monday, October 16, 2017, the Berrien County Board of Education unanimously approved to have NO makeup days for Hurricane Irma. There are no changes to the current school calendar.

post_text: Hello everyone! Welcome to the Berrien County Board of Education page. We are excited to be able to use this as a resource to keep you informed as well as share great things going on within our school community.
text: Hello everyone! Welcome to the Berrien County Board of Education page. We are excited to be able to use this as a resource to keep you informed as well as share great things going on within our school community.

post_text: The Berrien Board of Education recognized 3 teachers Monday night at the Board meeting. They were all recipients of teacher innovation grants. The people in the attached picture are: L-R Julie Williams, BOE Chairwoman; Becky Rogers, BHS Instructional Coach; Chrisie Osborne, BMS 6th grade Science teacher; Darcy Rainey, BMS 6th grade Math teacher; and Mark Morgan, Assistant Superintendent.
text: The Berrien Board of Education recognized 3 teachers Monday night at the Board meeting. They were all recipients of teacher innovation grants. The people in the attached picture are: L-R Julie Williams, BOE Chairwoman; Becky Rogers, BHS Instructional Coach; Chrisie Osborne, BMS 6th grade Science teacher; Darcy Rainey, BMS 6th grade Math teacher; and Mark Morgan, Assistant Superintendent.
